wikipedia_page.main: Peggy Hyland (born Gladys Lucy Hutchinson; 11 June 1884 – 19 September 1973) was an English silent film actress who after a brief period on the stage had a successful career as a silent film actress, appearing in at least 40 films in Great Britain and the United States between 1914 and 1925. In 1925 she returned to Britain after making her last film following which she lived a life of obscurity.

His initial feature was Her Bitter Cup in 1916, the year during which he was seen in sixteen shorts and features. 1917 was equally prolific for him, providing seventeen appearances. As short films gave way to features, the number of his annual productions decreased (four in 1918, four in 1919 and five in 1920),Large photograph of Edward Hearn in the 1920 edition of Who's Who on Screen via archive.org; accessed November 18, 2017. but he continued to work steadily, with film credits in every year of his career. He was third-billed in Faith, the 1920 production starring Peggy Hyland with J. Parks Jones, and had a supporting role that year in the serial, Daredevil Jack, a vehicle for boxing champion Jack Dempsey.Photograph of Edward Hearn c.1920 from W. Lee Cozad's book Those Magnificent Mountain Movies: The Golden Years 1911–1939, which also includes the incorrect statement that Hearn, rather than Jack Dempsey himself, played the boxing champ in Daredevil Jack

Polly Biggs (Peggy Hyland) is the eldest of a family of orphaned children who are taken in by their uncle, Mayor Hoadley (John S. Robertson). Hoadley despises the children and has only taken them in as good publicity for the upcoming election. His wife, Mrs. Hoadley (Julia Swayne Gordon) is equally cruel to the children, especially Polly.
* Peggy Hyland – Polly Biggs

In 1920, Granville went to England, where he worked as a cinematographer and director into the mid-1920s. Here he met and married the actress Peggy Hyland in 1923. The marriage was later dissolved. He died in London on 14 November 1932, from complications related to Bright's disease.

Sally Bishop is a 1916 British silent romance film directed by George Pearson and starring Marjorie Villis, Aurelio Sidney and Peggy Hyland.BFI.org It is an adaptation of the 1910 novel Sally Bishop, a Romance by E. Temple Thurston.
* Peggy Hyland - Janet Hallard
Forbidden Cargoes is a 1926 British silent adventure film directed by Fred LeRoy Granville and starring Peggy Hyland, Clifford McLaglen and James Lindsay.
* Peggy Hyland as Violet

John Halifax, Gentleman is a 1915 British silent drama film directed by George Pearson and starring Fred Paul, Peggy Hyland and Harry Paulo. It is an adaptation of the 1856 novel John Halifax, Gentleman by Dinah Craik.
* Peggy Hyland as Ursula March

Mr. Pim Passes By is a 1921 British silent comedy film directed by Albert Ward and starring Peggy Hyland, Campbell Gullan and Maudie Dunham. It was based on the 1919 play Mr. Pim Passes By by A.A. Milne.
* Peggy Hyland as Olivia Marsden

Caste was adapted for a 1915 British film directed by Laurence Trimble. Sir John Hare made his first appearance in motion pictures, reprising his acclaimed stage portrayal of Eccles. Other cast included Esme Hubbard (Polly Eccles), Campbell Gullan (Sam Gerridge), Peggy Hyland (Esther), Dawson Millward (Captain Hawtree), Roland Pertwee (George d'Alroy) and Mary Rorke (The Marquise) It is believed to be a lost film.

Saints and Sinners is a 1916 American drama silent film directed by James Kirkwood, Sr. and written by Hugh Ford and Henry Arthur Jones. The film stars Estar Banks, Hal Forde, Clarence Handyside, Peggy Hyland, William Lampe and Horace Newman. The film was released on May 25, 1916, by Paramount Pictures.
*Peggy Hyland as Letty Fletcher

A Pair of Spectacles is a 1916 British silent comedy film directed by Alexander Butler and starring John Hare, Peggy Hyland and Booth Conway, based on the play of the same name by Sydney Grundy. It was made at Isleworth Studios.Harris, p. 201
* Peggy Hyland as Mrs. Goldfinch
*Peggy Hyland - Leila Bard

The Honeypot is a 1920 British silent romance film directed by Fred LeRoy Granville and starring Peggy Hyland, Campbell Gullan and James Lindsay.Low p.383 It was made at Isleworth Studios. A sequel Love Maggy was released the following year.
* Peggy Hyland as Maggie Delamere

Love Maggy is a 1921 British silent drama film directed by Fred LeRoy Granville and starring Peggy Hyland, Campbell Gullan and James Lindsay.Quinlan p.121 It was made at Isleworth Studios as a sequel to the 1920 film The Honeypot.
* Peggy Hyland as Maggy Chalfont
A silent film adaptation was made in 1921, with Peggy Hyland, Hubert Harben and Campbell Gullan in the lead roles."Mr Pim Passes By", British Film Institute. Retrieved 22 April 2021

Faith is a 1920 American silent romantic drama film directed by Howard M. Mitchell and starring Peggy Hyland, J. Parks Jones, Guy Edward Hearn, and Winter Hall. The film was released by Fox Film Corporation on February 1920.
*Peggy Hyland as Peggy Laughlin
* Peggy Hyland as Barbara Herrick
The Sixteenth Wife is a 1917 American silent comedy drama film directed by Charles Brabin and starring Peggy Hyland, Marc McDermott and George J. Forth.Quinlan p.44
* Peggy Hyland as Olette

Bonnie Annie Laurie is a 1918 American silent drama film directed by Harry F. Millarde and starring Peggy Hyland, Henry Hallam, William Bailey, Sidney Mason, and Marion Singer. The film was released by Fox Film Corporation on September 1, 1918.
*Peggy Hyland as Annie Laurie
